result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeff M. Hyma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs which includes Drug abuse surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations if not already completed.

timeConds.notes: Community service to e completed in Texas.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions set forth in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeff M. Hyma

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation /s/TTF 5-29-15

Defendant Jeff M. Hyma in court with attorney Michael D. Hughes. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing and a Plea Hearing.

9:42 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins states no arraignment has been done on this  case.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Hughes has filed paperwork for a Preliminary Hearing.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing has been signed by Atty Hughes and his client.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Information has been received by Atty Hughes. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on all 3 counts.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Hughes makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement on his behalf prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
12 months probation
$500 fine + costs which includes drug abuse surcharge
50 hours community service to be completed in Texas
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations if not already completed 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Count 2 -
Sentence withheld
12 months probation concurrent to Count 1
$500 fine + costs which includes drug abuse surcharge
Comply with conditions set forth in Count 1

Count 3 -
Sentence withheld
12 months probation concurrent to Count 1 & 2
Pay costs and victim withness surcharge
Comply with conditions in Count 1 & 2
Plea hearing on November 24, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances unlawfully.

Defendant Jeff M. Hyma in court with attorney Michael D. Hughes. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Cousins recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
